channel.title: NYT > Style
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 The New York Times Company

item.title: Cory Booker Weds Alexis Lewis in a Private Ceremony
item.description: The couple legally married at a courthouse in Newark days before hosting an intimate wedding in Washington, D.C. on Saturday. They shared their wedding details exclusively with The New York Times.
item.dc:creator: Sadiba Hasan

item.title: A Brief History of Turkey Carving as an American Man’s Ritual
item.description: A brief history of an American ritual and the neuroses it inspires in modern men.
item.dc:creator: Joseph Bernstein
item.media:credit: L. J. Willinger/Keystone, via Getty Images
item.media:description: The history of carving, our reporter finds, is all about the expression of social roles, specifically male ones — doling out meat has always been a way for guys to perform being dudes.

item.title: Nara Smith Expands Her Brand From TikTok to Business Mogul
item.description: Nara Smith, the model, mother of four and influencer best known for making recipes “from scratch” for her family, is pursuing a new role: business mogul.
item.dc:creator: Iva Dixit
item.media:credit: Hiroko Masuike/The New York Times
item.media:description: Nara Smith wore a printed JW Anderson frock to prepare grilled cheeses during an event at Happier Grocery promoting the new garlic cooking oil that she developed for Algae Cooking Club.

item.title: Robert Irwin Wins ‘Dancing With the Stars’
item.description: His story began with loss, but the lessons of his “Crocodile Hunter” father helped Irwin spread a message of love as he won Season 34 of “Dancing With the Stars.”
item.dc:creator: Ashley Spencer
item.media:credit: Jennelle Fong for The New York Times
item.media:description: With his success on “Dancing With the Stars,” and his upcoming cameo in “Zootopia 2,” Mr. Irwin sees a future for himself that will require more time spent in the United States.

item.title: At Miss Universe, Miss Norway’s Salmon Costume Steals the Show
item.description: The designer behind Miss Norway’s wild outfit wasn’t surprised by the attention. “The original plan was to make noise.”
item.dc:creator: Jessica Roy
item.media:credit: Athit Perawongmetha/Reuters
item.media:description: Leonora Lysglimt-Rødland, who represented Norway at the Miss Universe pageant this month, dressed as a salmon during the event’s national costume contest.

item.title: Comedian Vir Das Fights Back After Official Rebukes in India
item.description: The comedian Vir Das, who has gained international fame despite intense criticism in his native India, has taken up boxing. He says it’s “good prep for adversity.”
item.dc:creator: Alisha Haridasani Gupta
item.category: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
item.media:credit: Eva Woolridge for The New York Times
item.media:description: Vir Das, a comedian, feels boxing is a steadying force in his life.

item.title: Will Dressing Up Fix Flying?
item.description: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy has introduced a campaign meant to encourage civility.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Getty Images
item.media:description: Clothes make the traveler: Once upon a time people dressed up on airplanes. Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy hopes to encourage them to do so again.

item.title: What Does My Puffer Jacket Say About Me?
item.description: Though the humble puffer can look casual, our critic explains how they’ve evolved from bulky outdoor necessity to symbol of quiet luxury.
item.dc:creator: Vanessa Friedman
item.media:credit: Edward Berthelot/Getty Images
item.media:description: Is there anywhere you can’t wear a puffer?

item.title: Mamdani’s Meeting With Trump Scrambled the MAGA-Sphere
item.description: Prominent conservative influencers had different interpretations as they processed the meeting on podcasts and in social media posts.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Taylor Pemberton
item.media:credit: Eric Lee for The New York Times
item.media:description: The meeting between Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect of New York City, and President Trump was not as explosive as some expected. Online, MAGA influencers and others on the right did not have a united response.

item.title: Ramona Young Clutches Her Pearls
item.description: A grandmother’s pearl necklace isn’t often worn, but still provides a sense of comfort to the actress, who stars in the new series “The Paper.”
item.dc:creator: Amelia Diamond
item.media:credit: Daniel Dorsa for The New York Times

item.title: A Fascinating Tale, Unearthed at a Sidewalk Sale
item.description: After a crowded stoop sale on a Brooklyn block caught one reporter’s eye, he traced the items to Georgia — and an elusive figure known as Miss Paula.
item.dc:creator: Ron Lieber
item.media:credit: Audra Melton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Thousands of articles of clothing sat abandoned in a closed vintage store in Georgia. Some of those items were sold at a sidewalk sale earlier this year in Park Slope, Brooklyn.

item.title: Their Obsession With Travel Points Led to an Unexpected Spark
item.description: Heather Peggs and George Igoe connected over frequent flier miles, but their chemistry sealed the deal. After their first date, she deleted her dating apps, and a month in, he knew she was “the one.”
item.dc:creator: Shivani Vora

item.title: The Three Times I Married My Wife
item.description: Saying wedding vows is one thing. Living up to them is quite another.
item.dc:creator: Brent Chaim Spodek
item.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: The Federal Shutdown Almost Delayed Their Marriage
item.description: Jared Brown and Daniel Roberts, who bonded over their work with the Obamas, had a meticulous engagement “rollout plan,” but securing a marriage license was the real test.
item.dc:creator: Valeriya Safronova

item.title: At 90 and 83, They Leaped Into Love Again
item.description: Marvin Hersel, a Navy veteran, and Maria Chavez, a retired medical translator from Mexico, fell in love at their senior living residence after swapping vivid childhood stories.
item.dc:creator: Emily Lang
item.media:credit: World Photo/Jacob Ford

item.title: A New Orleans Processional at a Grand Old Irish Estate
item.description: Morgan Evans and Colm Browne arrived at their wedding welcome party in Ireland in a second line led by a Dublin band.
item.dc:creator: Rosalie R. Radomsky

item.title: Labubu Takes New York on Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade Float
item.description: A global sensation gets her moment at the Thanksgiving Day parade.
item.dc:creator: Alyson Krueger
item.media:credit: Adam Gray/Getty Images
item.media:description: It’s Labubu’s first time in New York. On Thursday, she and other Pop Mart characters will appear atop a float in the Macy’s Thanksgiving Day Parade.

item.title: Do the Best Shoes Look Like … Potatoes?
item.description: When it comes to footwear, there’s one perfect shape (and we’re living in the golden era for it).
item.dc:creator: Jacob Gallagher

item.title: A Vintage Specialist Is Selling Off His Collection
item.description: Doug Bihlmaier, a hero to style influencers, is parting with rare jackets, boots, belts and workwear items.
item.dc:creator: Steven Kurutz
item.media:credit: Amir Hamja for The New York Times
item.media:description: Doug Bihlmaier amassed his collection of vintage goods while working for Ralph Lauren.

item.title: Charity Sponsor Programs Want to Solve Gift Giving Problems
item.description: Charity sponsorship programs want to solve your holiday giving problems.
item.dc:creator: Jessica Bumpus

item.title: 3 Children’s Books With a Bit of Sparkle
item.description: Three recently released children’s books focus on gems, fine jewelry and even collectible watches.
item.dc:creator: Amy Elliott

item.title: Experts in the Handmade Suggest Gifts With a Human Touch
item.description: The recommendations from five specialists range from olive oil to high-design lighting.
item.dc:creator: Tanya Dukes

item.title: Tiny Love Stories: ‘No Hugging … and Definitely Nothing Lewd’
item.description: Modern Love in miniature, featuring reader-submitted stories of no more than 100 words.
item.media:credit: Brian Rea

item.title: I Think My Good Friend Is Betraying Me, but I’m Not Sure. What Should I Do?
item.description: A reader suspects that a friend is divulging her secrets. If not, why do people around town seem to know her personal business?
item.dc:creator: Philip Galanes
item.media:credit: Miguel Porlan

item.title: A Therapist’s Advice on How to Navigate the Holiday Season With Family
item.description: Family holidays can be stressful. They don’t have to be.
item.dc:creator: Anna Martin

item.title: New York Influencer Dined and Dashed at Fine Restaurants, Owners and Police Say
item.description: Restaurant owners in Brooklyn have warned one another about a woman who frequents their establishments, photographs her food and then doesn’t pay for it.
item.dc:creator: Michael Levenson
item.category: Peter Luger Steak House (Brooklyn, NY, Restaurant)
item.media:credit: Clay Williams for The New York Times
item.media:description: Francie, a Michelin-starred brasserie in Brooklyn, and one of several restaurants where the authorities say the self-styled influencer Pei-Yun Chung dined before leaving without paying.

item.title: Street Style Look of the Week: Red Pants
item.description: Meaningful accessories finished an outfit combining solid colors and prints.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha

item.title: Who Chanel and Louis Vuitton Have Called When Making Woven Leather Bags
item.description: As Craig Wright has built his brand, Dragon Diffusion, he has quietly built a reputation as a leather craftsman for Hermès, Chanel and others. Now he’s ready to talk about it.
item.dc:creator: Chantel Tattoli and Priyadarshini Ravichandran
item.media:credit: Priyadarshini Ravichandran for The New York Times

item.title: Marilyn Minter Is Camera Ready
item.description: The 77-year-old artist has spent her career observing others. Now, with the documentary “Pretty Dirty: The Life and Times of Marilyn Minter,” she becomes the star.
item.dc:creator: Thessaly La Force
item.category: Pretty Dirty: The Life and Times of Marilyn Minter (Movie)
item.media:credit: Luisa Opalesky for The New York Times
item.media:description: Marilyn Minter in her studio. “The people I shoot have been in the eye,” she said about some of the subjects she’s interested in such as Pamela Anderson and Monica Lewinsky. “They’ve been slightly broken or really broken by the system.”

item.title: Why That Whitney Houston Drum Beat Is So Addictive, Yet Hard to Match
item.description: People online have been trying to nail the drumbeat before the final chorus of “I Will Always Love You.” It’s harder than it looks.
item.dc:creator: Neil Vigdor
item.media:credit: Michelle Groskopf for The New York Times
item.media:description: “I think it’s fun,” he said of the interest in the song’s drumbeat. “It sort of made me rethink how long the pause is.”

item.title: Farida Khelfa, French Fashion’s Most Influential Muse, Is Having a Closet Sale
item.description: Farida Khelfa modeled for Gaultier, Alaïa and more. In turn, they gave her clothes. Now she’s letting go of 200 items from her fabled wardrobe.
item.dc:creator: Dana Thomas
item.media:credit: Dolly Faibyshev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Farida Khelfa in New York in 2023.

item.title: Hong Kong’s Global Style: How Locals and Tourists Shape Its Fashion Identity
item.description: Residents and visitors from all over give the city a diverse visual flavor.
item.dc:creator: Simbarashe Cha
item.media:description: Tattoos, a graphic T-shirt and the view of Hong Kong Island’s skyline outside the M+ museum.
